Package io.permazen.core.type

Class Base64ArrayType<T,​E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.core.FieldType<T>
      • io.permazen.core.type.NonNullFieldType<T>
        • io.permazen.core.type.ArrayType<T,​E>
          • io.permazen.core.type.Base64ArrayType<T,​E>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - array type
    E - array element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleArrayType, FloatArrayType, IntegralArrayType
    public abstract class Base64ArrayType<T,​E>
extends ArrayType<T,​E>
    For Primitive array types encode to String via Base-64 encoding of raw data. Does not support null arrays.

    Note: in order to return a String that is self-delimiting, toParseableString() appends an extra "=" character when the length of the array is equal to 3 (mod 4).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public T fromString​(String string)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Parse a non-null value previously encoded by toString(T).

        The implementation in FieldType creates a new ParseContext based on string, delegates to FieldType.toParseableString(T) to parse it, and verifies that all of string was consumed during the parse. Subclasses that override this method should also override toString(T).

        Overrides:
        fromString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        string - non-null value previously encoded as a String by toString(T)
        Returns:
        actual value

      • toString

        public String toString​(T array)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Encode a non-null value as a String for later decoding by fromString().

        Each of the characters in the returned String must be one of the valid XML characters (tab, newline, carriage return, \u0020 - \ud7ff, and \ue000 - \fffdf).

        The implementation in FieldType checks that value is not null, then delegates to FieldType.toParseableString(T). Subclasses that override this method should also override fromString().

        Overrides:
        toString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        array - actual value, never null
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromString()
        See Also:
        The XML 1.0 Specification

      • toString

        public String toString​(T array,
                       boolean base64)
        Encode a non-null value as a String for later decoding by fromString().

        This class supports two String encodings: base 64 and "list" syntax with square brackets and commas. The method toString(Object) returns the base 64 form; this method works exactly the same way but allows the caller to specify which form to generate. Either form is parseable by fromString().

        Parameters:
        array - array to encode, never null
        base64 - true for base 64 synax, false for list syntax
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromString()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is null

      • toParseableString

        public String toParseableString​(T array)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Encode a possibly null value as a String for later decoding by fromParseableString(). The string value must be self-delimiting, i.e., decodable even when followed by arbitrary additional characters, and must not start with whitespace or closing square bracket ("]").

        In addition, each of the characters in the returned String must be one of the valid XML characters (tab, newline, carriage return, \u0020 - \ud7ff, and \ue000 - \fffdf).

        Overrides:
        toParseableString in class ArrayType<T,​E>
        Parameters:
        array - actual value (possibly null)
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromParseableString()
        See Also:
        The XML 1.0 Specification

      • toParseableString

        public String toParseableString​(T array,
                                boolean base64)
        Encode a possibly null value as a String for later decoding by fromParseableString().

        This class supports two String encodings: base 64 and "list" syntax with square brackets and commas. The method toParseableString(Object) returns the base 64 form; this method works exactly the same way but allows the caller to specify which form to generate. Either form is parseable by fromParseableString().

        Parameters:
        array - array to encode, possibly null
        base64 - true for base 64 synax, false for list syntax
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromParseableString()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is null and this type does not support null
